articles.description: Australia bowler Mitchell Starc becomes the most expensive signing in Indian Premier League history on being bought by Kolkata Knight Riders.
articles.title: Starc breaks record for most expensive buy at IPL

articles.description: Chelsea, Newcastle and Everton are among teams involved in Carabao Cup quarter-finals on Tuesday while Manchester City play in the Club World Cup.
articles.title: Latest football news, Club World Cup and EFL Cup build-up

articles.description: Drew Lock throws a touchdown pass with just 28 seconds remaining as the Seattle Seahawks keep their play-off hopes alive with a dramatic victory over the Philadelphia Eagles.
articles.title: Lock inspires Seahawks to win over Eagles

articles.description: Pep Guardiola has changed the role of the full-back. Former Germany and Bayern Munich defender Philipp Lahm tells BBC Sport why and how it has been done.
articles.title: Why full-backs will never be same again

articles.description: La Liga surprise package Girona beat Alaves to move back to the top of the table.
articles.title: Girona beat Alaves to return to top of La Liga

articles.description: Deontay Wilder believes Anthony Joshua is "75% afraid" to fight him, but says a bout between the former heavyweight champions is closer than it ever has been.
articles.title: Joshua doesn't have the heart to fight me - Wilder

articles.description: Argentina appoint former fly-half Felipe Contepomi to replace Michael Cheika as their head coach.
articles.title: Contepomi succeeds Cheika as Argentina head coach

articles.description: Manchester City midfielder Jill Roord says "everything is possible" in the Women's Super League title race after ending the year with victory over Everton.
articles.title: Everything possible in WSL title race - Roord

articles.description: Aston Villa's form is amazing but they need to keep Ollie Watkins fit to stay near the top of the Premier League, says MOTD2 pundit Alan Shearer.
articles.title: 'Watkins is key for amazing Villa - but don't count Man City out'

articles.description: Tiger Woods believes he can still win on the PGA Tour but will only play one event per month in 2024 as he continues his recovery from ankle surgery.
articles.title: I can still win on PGA Tour - Woods
